verses.kjv: O God, my heart is fixed; I will sing and give praise, even with my glory.
verses.ct: My heart is steady, God; I will sing and make music with everything in me.

verses.kjv: Awake, psaltery and harp: I myself will awake early.
verses.ct: Wake up, harp and lyre! I will rise before the dawn.

verses.kjv: I will praise thee, O LORD, among the people: and I will sing praises unto thee among the nations.
verses.ct: I will thank you, LORD, in front of all people, and I will sing your praises among the nations.

verses.kjv: For thy mercy is great above the heavens: and thy truth reacheth unto the clouds.
verses.ct: Your mercy towers higher than the heavens, and your faithfulness stretches to the clouds.

verses.kjv: Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens: and thy glory above all the earth;
verses.ct: Rise up above the heavens, God, and let your glory cover the entire earth,

verses.kjv: That thy beloved may be delivered: save with thy right hand, and answer me.
verses.ct: so that those you love may be rescued. Save us with your powerful hand and answer me.

verses.kjv: God hath spoken in his holiness; I will rejoice, I will divide Shechem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.
verses.ct: God has declared from his sanctuary: 'I will celebrate! I will divide up Shechem and measure out the valley of Succoth.

verses.kjv: Gilead is mine; Manasseh is mine; Ephraim also is the strength of mine head; Judah is my lawgiver;
verses.ct: Gilead belongs to me, and Manasseh belongs to me. Ephraim is my helmet, and Judah is my ruling staff.

verses.kjv: Moab is my washpot; over Edom will I cast out my shoe; over Philistia will I triumph.
verses.ct: Moab is my washbasin; I will toss my sandal onto Edom; I will shout in victory over Philistia.'

verses.kjv: Who will bring me into the strong city? who will lead me into Edom?
verses.ct: Who will bring me to the fortified city? Who will lead me all the way to Edom?

verses.kjv: Wilt not thou, O God, who hast cast us off? and wilt not thou, O God, go forth with our hosts?
verses.ct: Haven't you rejected us, God? Won't you march out with our armies, God?

verses.kjv: Give us help from trouble: for vain is the help of man.
verses.ct: Give us relief from our enemies, because human help is worthless.

verses.kjv: Through God we shall do valiantly: for he it is that shall tread down our enemies.
verses.ct: With God on our side, we will act with courage, because he is the one who will crush our enemies.
